org.simplity.kernel.file

Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.kernel.file.FileManager

  • public class FileManager
extends Object
    File has a simple connotation to most programmers : it is available on the disk. if you write to it, you should be able to read it later, even across layers. file manager will try to provide that view
    Author:
    simplity.org

    • Method Detail

      • setContext

        public static void setContext(javax.servlet.ServletContext ctx)
        Parameters:
        ctx - servlet context

      • getResources

        public static String[] getResources(String parentFolder)
        get a collection suitable for for-in loop.

        e.g (for File file : FileManager.getCollection(folder, extension){}

        Parameters:
        parentFolder -
        Returns:
        collection of file names prefixed with the parent folder. never null. will be an empty collection in case of any error. (like non-existing folder)

      • readResource

        public static String readResource(String fileName)
                           throws Exception
        read a resource file and return its contents
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name relative to application root to be read
        Returns:
        file content
        Throws:
        Exception - in case of any issue while reading this file

      • getResourceStream

        public static InputStream getResourceStream(String fileName)
                                     throws Exception
        get input stream for a resource. Typically used by XML util to create a document
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name relative to application root to be read
        Returns:
        stream, or null if resource could not be located
        Throws:
        Exception - in case of any issue while reading this file

      • createTempFile

        public static File createTempFile()
        create an empty temp file
        Returns:
        file, never null.

      • createTempFile

        public static File createTempFile(InputStream inStream)
        create a temp file using the bytes in the stream. We DO NOT close inStream, based on the tradition creator-should-close after reading
        Parameters:
        inStream - from which to create the content of the file.
        Returns:
        file, in which this inStream is saved. file.getName() is unique, and can be used for next readFile() calls

      • createTempFile

        public static File createTempFile(Reader reader)
        create a temp file using the reader. reader is not closed, simply because we did not create it
        Parameters:
        reader - from which to create the content of the file.
        Returns:
        file, in which this reader is saved. file.getName() is unique, and can be used for next readFile() calls

      • getTempFile

        public static File getTempFile(String fileName)
        get an output stream for this temp file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name that was returned from an earlier call to createTempFile()
        Returns:
        stream, or null if file not found.

      • deleteTempFile

        public static void deleteTempFile(String fileName)
        tray and delete a temp file with the given name. No error is raised even if the delete operation fails.
        Parameters:
        fileName - to be deleted.

      • streamToFile

        public static boolean streamToFile(File file,
                                   InputStream inputStream)
        creates a file, (or re-writes its contents) from an input stream. Use nio package instead of this utility if you use java 7 or later.
        Parameters:
        file - File is created if required. contents over-ridden if file exists.
        inputStream - from which to read. Should not have been opened. we will open and close it.
        Returns:
        true if all okay. False otherwise. we do do not tell you what happened, but write that to trace.

      • copyOut

        public static void copyOut(InputStream in,
                           OutputStream out)
                    throws IOException
        copy bytes one stream to the other. Note that we do not close the streams, because we follow the golden rule that open-close should happen in the same method.
        Parameters:
        in - input stream to copy from
        out - output stream to copy to
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of any io error during copy

      • readFile

        public static String readFile(File file)
        if the file is small, why the fuss. Just get it as string as UTF-8
        Parameters:
        file -
        Returns:
        file content as UTF-8 text

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile(File file,
                             String text)
        if the file is small, why the fuss. Just get it as string as UTF-8
        Parameters:
        file -
        text - file content to be written as UTF-8
